rev.comment: almost always it is a good idea to avoid the wording "controversy"
rev.diff:
Line 89: Line 89:
Parallels Desktop for Mac Build 5608 added support for guest Parallels Tools for Linux in the latest Linux distributions (including Ubuntu 8). It also added support for running 3D graphics in Windows virtual machines on Mac OS X Leopard 10.5.3.
Parallels Desktop for Mac Build 5608 added support for guest Parallels Tools for Linux in the latest Linux distributions (including Ubuntu 8). It also added support for running 3D graphics in Windows virtual machines on Mac OS X Leopard 10.5.3.
â
===Wine controversy===
+
===Use of code from the Wine project===
According to Parallels' Licensing page, Desktop for Mac version 3.0 contains [[Direct3D]] code that was originally developed by the [[Wine (software)|Wine]] [[open source]] project.<ref>[http://www.parallels.com/en/support/desktop/licensing/ Licensing information]. Parallels, Inc. Retrieved on 2007-07-16.</ref> Wine software is licensed under the [[GNU Lesser General Public License]], which required Parallels to release the [[source code]]. Parallels released the modified source code on July 2, 2007, about 2 weeks after the promised release date.<ref>DÃ¶singer, Stefan (2007-07-03). [http://wiki.winehq.org/Parallels Parallels Desktop Watch]. The official Wine Wiki. Retrieved on 2007-07-30.</ref> A Parallels spokesman explained the reasons for the delay in a message on the official company blog.<ref>Rudolph, Ben (July 3, 2007). [http://parallelsvirtualization.blogspot.com/2007/07/lowdown-on-parallels-wine.html The Lowdown on Parallels & Wine]. Retrieved on 2007-07-30.</ref>
